name: Tella
description: A home-brewed Ethiopian beer made from barley, maize, or teff, often enjoyed during celebrations and gatherings.

name: Tej
description: A traditional Ethiopian honey wine flavored with a type of hops called 'gesho leaves', served during festivals and special occasions.

name: Buna (Ethiopian Coffee)
description: Experience the Ethiopian coffee ceremony with this rich, aromatic coffee served traditionally in small cups.

name: Atmet
description: A traditional Ethiopian barley drink mixed with milk and flavored with spices like ginger and cardamomâ€”perfect for cold mornings.

name: Koso
description: A traditional herbal drink known for its medicinal properties, especially used in rural Ethiopian communities.

name: Cheka
description: A fermented cereal beverage traditionally consumed in the southwestern regions of Ethiopia, often thick and porridge-like.
